# discord_guild_scheduled_event (Resource)

Manages a Discord guild scheduled event.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# SPDX-License-Identifier: MPL-2.0

locals {
  guild_id = "123456789012345678" # Replace with your guild ID
}

# Manage an external scheduled event (e.g., a meetup)
resource "discord_guild_scheduled_event" "meetup" {
  guild_id = local.guild_id
  name     = "Community Meetup"

  description        = "Join us for our monthly community meetup!"
  scheduled_start_time = "2025-12-01T18:00:00Z"
  scheduled_end_time   = "2025-12-01T20:00:00Z"

  # Entity type: 1=STAGE_INSTANCE, 2=VOICE, 3=EXTERNAL
  entity_type = 3

  # Required for EXTERNAL events
  entity_metadata_location = "Discord Stage Channel"

  # Privacy level: 2=GUILD_ONLY (default)
  privacy_level = 2
}

# Manage a voice channel event
resource "discord_guild_scheduled_event" "game_night" {
  guild_id = local.guild_id
  name     = "Game Night"

  description          = "Weekly game night in voice chat"
  scheduled_start_time = "2025-12-05T20:00:00Z"
  entity_type          = 2                        # VOICE
  channel_id           = "123456789012345678"      # Replace with your voice channel ID
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `entity_type` (Number) The entity type (1 = STAGE_INSTANCE, 2 = VOICE, 3 = EXTERNAL).
- `guild_id` (String) The ID of the guild.
- `name` (String) The name of the scheduled event (1-100 characters).
- `scheduled_start_time` (String) The scheduled start time in ISO8601 format.

### Optional

- `channel_id` (String) The channel ID. Required for STAGE_INSTANCE and VOICE entity types.
- `description` (String) The description of the scheduled event (1-1000 characters).
- `entity_metadata_location` (String) The location of the event. Required for EXTERNAL entity type.
- `image` (String) The cover image for the event (data URI or URL).
- `privacy_level` (Number) The privacy level (2 = GUILD_ONLY).
- `scheduled_end_time` (String) The scheduled end time in ISO8601 format. Required for EXTERNAL events.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of the scheduled event.
- `status` (Number) The status of the scheduled event (1 = SCHEDULED, 2 = ACTIVE, 3 = COMPLETED, 4 = CANCELED).
